SENT.plain: Homozygous achondroplasia is a rare yet distinct clinical entity
Most infants succumb to an early death as a result of respiratory compromise due to upper airway obstruction, thoracic cage deformity, and/or cervicomedullary compression
The successful cervicomedullary decompression of a 16-week-old infant with homozygous achondroplasia is described
This report suggests that homozygous achondroplasia is not universally fatal and that these infants are potentially viable if managed by aggressive respiratory and surgical measures
